bgc:general.bgc:title: Trait data about What Where When

bgc:variable.bgc:name: scientificName
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Original character string provided as species name by the data owner (kept for reference only)

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitName
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Name of the trait as used by the data provider (kept for compatibility on provider side).

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Unique identifier of the trait following a public or user-provided thesaurus of traits.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitValue
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Measured raw value or factor level for this species trait as measured and provided by the author.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitUnit
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Reports the unit that the author’s raw data were measured in, if applicable (only for numeric values). For unitless numerical values, use ‘unitless’ in this field. For factorial values, leave empty or provide NA.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: scientificNameStd
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Full scientific name (with authorship and date information if known). It should be an accepted taxon name according to a published taxonomy (provided in taxonID).

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitNameStd
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Descriptive Name of the trait reported. This should follow the controlled vocabulary of a thesaurus of traits available online or published along with the dataset.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitValueStd
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Standardised measured value or factor level for this species trait. Numerical values must use the correct unit. Factor levels must be compliant with the thesaurus of traits.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: traitUnitStd
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The units associated with the measurementValue. The expected standard unit for this trait as defined in the traitlist/ thesaurus.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: taxonID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Verified name identifier of the species or subspecies (or higher taxon) for which this value was collected. Each entry should link to a published reference species list/taxonomy. Avoid synonyms.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A unique, dataset-specific identifier. Links multi-value trait measurements, e.g. x-y-z coordinates of a morphometric landmark, biochemical compound quantities for different chainlengths. In this case, the trait names must specifiy the sub-measurement, e.g. “landmark32_x”, and must be specified in a reference trait list, given in the field “measurementMethod”.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: occurrenceID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A character string user defined by the data author. It is recommended best practice to use a globally unique identifier, if available, e.g. a museum ID referring to the individual specimen from which the data were measured. usually does not apply for literature data.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: warnings
bgc:variable.bgc:description: warnings from the R-script will be stored here, e.g. regarding a lack of match between the provided taxonID and the ontology, or the trait names or values, a mismatch in the units provided and the unit expected according to the trait table. User defined warnings and flags can be added as well, e.g. ‘NOTUSE’.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: taxonRank
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: kingdom
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: phylum
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: class
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: order
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: family
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: genus
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: basisOfRecord
bgc:variable.bgc:description: How and from which kind of specimen were the data obtained? Make use of controlled vocabulary. Valid entries are: ‘LivingSpecimen’; ‘PreservedSpecimen’; ‘FossilSpecimen’; ‘literatureData’; ‘traitDatabase’; ‘expertKnowledge’ (see Comments)

bgc:variable.bgc:name: basisOfRecordDescription
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Adding more detail to the basisOfRecord.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: references
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Precise reference to the source. If literature data, this should quote the book or online database. If museum specimen, this should report the name of the collection. If expert knowledge, this should name the authority, preferrably using ORCID. If trait database, provide reference to the original publication, DOI or URL of the trait-database.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementResolution
bgc:variable.bgc:description: If the trait information was originally given on another taxonomic level than species. Applies mainly for literature and expert knowledge data. not applying for measured data. The hierarchical level to which the trait data would refer.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementMethod
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Applies primarily to measured data. The method, tools and scales used to measure a (numerical) trait value. A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementDeterminedBy
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the measurement.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementDeterminedDate
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementRemarks
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Remarks concerning a particular measurement, e.g. additional information on the quality and reliability, reference or acknowledgments.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: aggregateMeasure
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Is measurementValue reporting an individual measurement or an aggregate Measure? Takes a binary entry: TRUE or FALSE

bgc:variable.bgc:name: individualCount
bgc:variable.bgc:description: If measurement is an aggregate measure of multiple individuals or specimens, report number of specimens as count, i.e. integer number. Defaults to 1

bgc:variable.bgc:name: dispersion
bgc:variable.bgc:description: If aggregate measure of multiple individuals or specimens, the numeric value of dispersion (variance or standard deviation) for the mean value reported in measurementValue_user (no unit conversion is provided by the R-package!). Defaults to 0. If a value is provided, report the statistical method in the field statisticalMethod.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementValue_min
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The lower boundary of observed values. Instead of or in addition to dispersion metric.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementValue_max
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The upper boundary of observed values. Instead of or in addition to dispersion metric.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: measurementAccuracy
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: statisticalMethod
bgc:variable.bgc:description: For aggregated measures, the method for data aggregation or averaging as well as the variation or range.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: sex
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Defining the sex of the measured specimen, to capture dimorphisms. Standardised factor levels are: “male”, “female”, “subadult”, “unknown”, “hermaphrodite”

bgc:variable.bgc:name: lifeStage
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The life stage of the measured specimen.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: age
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The age of the specimen in years.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: morphotype
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The morphotype of the observed specimen.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: eventID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The sampling event or campaign. A globally valid URI or user specified character string that links to another table providing detailed information, e.g. environmental or temporal parameters, descriptions on methods etc..

bgc:variable.bgc:name: preparations
bgc:variable.bgc:description: For preserved specimens, a list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for the occurence.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: samplingProtocol
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used for obtaining the specimen.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: year
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The four-digit year, at which the specimens were extracted or sampled.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: month
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The ordinal month, in which the specimens were extracted or sampled.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: day
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The integer day of the month on which the specimens were extracted or sampled.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: eventDate
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Represents the date, at which the specimens were extracted or sampled. If providing eventDate, then enter format of type: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm TIMEZONE (fall back to 12:00 if no time is available). For lower precision, use year, month and day field instead.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: locationID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A globally unique or dataset-specific identifier. Could report the plot within the experimental setting which would be further specified in the metadata or in a separate dataset.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: habitat
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A character string reporting habitat type from which the specimen was sampled. E.g. ‘forest’, ‘grassland’, ‘oak savanna’, ‘pre-cordilleran steppe’. It is recommended to link to ecological ontologies, if available, using public URIs.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: decimalLongitude
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: decimalLatitude
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: elevation
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The geographic elevation in meters above sea level.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: geodeticDatum
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The geodeticDatum defines the ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based. Recommended system is “WGS84”. Use the EPSG code to provide an SRS. Examples: “EPSG:4326”, “WGS84”, “NAD27”, “Campo Inchauspe”, “European 1950”, “Clarke 1866”*

bgc:variable.bgc:name: verbatimLocality
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: country
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: countryCode
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: occurenceRemarks
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: rightsHolder
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource, i.e. this dataset.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: bibliographicCitation
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A bibliographic reference for the resource as a statement indicating how this record should be cited (attributed) when used. Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: license
bgc:variable.bgc:description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: datasetID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: datasetName
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: author
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The person, organisation or service primarily responsible for making the dataset.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: version
bgc:variable.bgc:description: The version of the dataset.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: OriginBE
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Did measured specimens originate from Exploratories Plots? TRUE or FALSE, defaults to FALSE

bgc:variable.bgc:name: BEPlotID
bgc:variable.bgc:description: EP plot ID (or also any valid Gridplot ID or VIP ID) where the measured specimen was extracted. Only for specimen that were extracted from the exploratories directly (or direct offspring, if hatched in the lab). Please also report it, even if this was not part of your research question and provide a Date (a year at last) if available.

bgc:variable.bgc:name: Exploratory
bgc:variable.bgc:description: Exploratories Region (Hainich, Schorfheide, Alb) for sorting purpose and readability, or if exact Plot ID is not available. Report the Region in format: HAI; SCH; ALB

bgc:variable.bgc:name: BEType
bgc:variable.bgc:description: W for forest or G for grassland plot.
